aline.ferone: @shanboody I have been in that toxic relationship 90% draining/10% energizing and now I am in a healthy relationship 10% conflict /, 90% energizing. And it's actually with the SAME person!!!!! It's because I have been in a bad place back then, so I attracted bad behavior in my partner. I basically didn't give the other person a choice but to fullfill my negative inner patterns. The more I focused on self development, the stronger I became and the more respectful behavior I attracted into my life. Interestingly, at the same time, my partner developed too, just like me. It's still amazing to me when I look back on our journey! I'm not saying you should stick with a toxic relationship in hope it gets better. Of course not. But if BOTH people work on themselves on their own decision, it can be a catapult of growth. On the other hand, I believe, if I had broken out of the toxic relationship back then, WITHOUT looking at and working on myself, I would have attracted the same toxic relationship just with another partner! ♥️☀️

brwneyes__: I would have to disagree on the definition. I think our relationships aren’t meant to be self serving or what you can get out of them . butwhoamireallly: Didn't realize until 6yrs in....I literally didn't know the meaning of manipulation until I met them. I am a giver and I gave endlessly, any and everything for them.
